channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ME
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ME

item.title: Report E-2025010289
item.description:
Report E-2025010289

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-25T00:50:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: One 01/21/2025, at approximately 21:14 hours, personnel in the CSX Rigby Yard in Portland, Maine, discovered tank car TEIX 33556 , load of Liquefied Petroleum Gas, was leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, AUX Sable Liquid Products, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2025-01-21-00171). Additionally, the South Portland Fire Department and Maine Department of the Environmental Protection were notified. Fire department personnel responded and found the cause of the release was the tank car’s sample line valve was partially open and the secondary securement plug was less than tool tight. Fire department personnel closed the valve to stop the release. HEPACO, a CSX emergency response contractor, was also dispatched to the incident to conduct a secondary inspection and ensure the car was properly secured for transportation. The issue was identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Brad Brancato (brad.brancato@auxsable.com).

item.title: Report E-2025020247
item.description:
Report E-2025020247

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: MARS HILL
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPRESS NATURAL GAS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Trailer was in line to unload and while waiting to decant. Temps were below 0 deg F. The normally open fire protection system lost supply pressure due to a frozen 1/4" swagelok tube blockage from frozen oil. All 4 cyclinders vented. The required consistant supply pressure was at 0 psig from a normal 90-100 psig supply the the FPS system fed off the bottom right hand tank

item.title: Report E-2025020246
item.description:
Report E-2025020246

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-27
  • City: LITTLETON
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPRESS NATURAL GAS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Trailer was statonary at Westerdhals Garage in Littleton, ME for chassis issue repair. Temps dropped into single digits and the normally open fire protection system lost supply pressure due to a frozen 1/4" swagelok tube blockage from frozen oil. Only the top left tank vented and the other three started to open. XNG was able to secure and lock out the other 3. The consistant supply pressure was at 20 psig from a normal 90-100 psig supply the the FPS system fed off the bottom right hand tank
